author: Jon Zanan
text: "Spice levels have been toned down too much. The spicy tom yum soup is now like a mild broth. I haaaaate that they mix chopped lemon grass into the squid salad because it's hard and isn't easy to pick out. Other than that...food is good and price right."

author: Larry Qin
text: 'Good
column5: accessible food and friendly service'

author: Frank Fettuccine
text: 'This was actual dog food. I had one bite of the drunken noodles and threw it away. Horrible.'

author: rajkumar PARDASANI
text: 'Quick service. Food was average.\nU must specify the degree of spice.'

author: Raj Pardasani
text: 'Good food . Quick service.'

author: David C
text: "Food is way way way too salty. Basically paid 15 bucks for a container of food about the size of a pint. The meat was incredibly dried out and just no love in the food. Wouldn't order ever again."

author: Barak Nizgoda
text: 'Great service and good food. Chicken pad Thai 9/10
column5: yellow chicken curry 6/10. Would definitely go back.'

author: Luca De Simone
text: 'The place has few tables inside and some more outside.\nService is good
column5: food used to be excellent
column6: now is just good
column7: but maybe what we ordered was not the best choice. The Shumai were ok
column11: overcooked. BYOB.\nExcellent location on a not busy street just a block from Washington Street.\nStreet parking only.'

author: Andrew Marshall
text: 'Really good food and fast delivery.'

author: Luis Del Orbe
text: 'Delicious food and very good friendly service.'

author: Keith Hills
text: "Food and service was outstanding!! It doesn't get better than this."

author: Zanna
text: "I order from this restaurant probably every other day! They have the best curry and I've tried them all. I get yellow curry and it's the perfect amount of curry to rice ratio.... so good. Pad thai is great as well. Comes quick and warm every time. Highly recommend!"

author: Paresh Patel
text: 'We ordered Panang curry and the taste was decent. We Dine in and the experience was ok. Overall the experience was good.'

author: Pete
text: 'We did takeout - food was pretty good but a little salty. Also wished the portions were bigger.'

author: Kool 1
text: 'Very personal setting
column5: service and food was great!'

author: Johan de Nysschen
text: 'When you experience something as poor as this you have a duty to post a review. This was by far the poorest take out meal experience in recent memory. The chicken green curry was so over salted it was not only inedible- no exaggeration
column5: it went to the garbage bin- but likely would represent a health hazard. Avoid this place there are many alternative Thai restaurants in Hoboken.'

author: Buyannemekh Munkhbat
text: 'Ubereats delivery was good. Delicious pad see ew. Steamed dumplings were just amazing.'

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'I ordered here for takeout on a Friday night and had no issues with my order
column5: ready for me when I arrived. I got the Thai iced tea
column6: pad Thai and the jungle curry! Would definitely recommend the pad Thai but I think I’ll try a different curry next time since it wasn’t my favorite and they have an extensive menu!'

author: Akansha Sharma
text: 'The best THAI food I’ve had in the neighborhood. The food is absolutely delicious and the staff is friendly. They do have spaced out dine in available now. If looking for a vegetarian option I would highly recommend the Tofu Gra Praw or the Kaw Pad Gra Prow'

author: Prasad Jape
text:
'Sri Thai is a lovely place of Thai cuisine with homemade touch. We have been here couple of times now and every time food has been delicious.

They have both indoor and outdoor seating. We had called in advance for reservation and did not require to wait for the table. They also sanitize the table in between guests.

We ordered Spicy Noodles and Panang Curry with Tofu Tod. Food was delicious and perfectly balanced. We asked for little spicy and it was good. They have BYOB. Also
column5: they have non-alcoholic drinks.\n\nStaff is friendly and can customize the order if needed.'

author: Jeff Henriquez
text: 'Always great service.'

author: Ryan Kulp
text: 'I’ve been waiting.... for some good Thai food. This is that go to Thai food spot I’ve been waiting for. I had the drunken noodles and finished it in about 10 mins. Soooo good. Best in Hoboken'

author: Alfredo Franco
text: "One of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to! Love their chicken with broccoli with peanut sauce. Always good to try new places
column5: and would definitely recommend this to others!"

author: Darrell Anderson
text: 'Nice neighborhood spot. Will try again when they lift the restrictions. I had the chicken satay  for the appetizer
column5: and a chicken with ginger sauce. Very good. Their outdoor seating was kind of awkward.....good food and service. And I liked the prices very much.'

author: Oğuz Furkan
text: 'I ordered food for my family meeting and they send me a wrong food and charged me $60 for 1 food. Tried to call them but when i tried to speak with the manager they told me they are busy and hung up the phone.'

author: Harrison Pointe Condo Assoc.
text: 'Excellent food
column5: excellent service. Highly recommended.'

author: james maniego
text: 'Do not order from this place..!!!they are a rip off..they didn’t give me my full order and when I asked them to refund me for my order they didn’t even refund me the right amount..they tried to refund me less than what they charged..the worse place ever..and the food taste awful too..not worth the price they charge'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "*Quarantine Delivery Review*\n\nGood Thai restaurants are slim pickin's in Hoboken. Judging from the reviews
column5: it seems like Sri Thai is the best one in the neighborhood
column6: so we decided to order dinner from there on a Thursday night via Uber Eats. That was when I found out that we have actually ordered from here before
column7: because the app recommended some dishes to 'order again'. Clearly
column8: it was not very memorable and this second time around
column9:
it was no different.

We ordered:

Chicken wings - these were actually pretty good. I loved the sweet chili sauce it came with
Pla Mueg Tod (fried squid) - underwhelming
column10: and a bit soggy and bland. Good thing this also came with that sweet chili sauce\nPad Thai with shrimp - pretty basic. The noodle texture was good
column11: but could have used more flavor. I solved that problem by adding some garlic chili sauce. The shrimp was kind of overcooked/dry. I added extra noodles for $2 and had more than enough for leftovers the next day\nLamb Pad Ped - this is not something we would normally order but my fiance said he wanted to try something new. It's basically slices of lamb and eggplant in a curry-like sauce. It surprisingly wasn't bad. The lamb didn't have any of that gamey taste that it can sometimes have. However
column12: the meat was a bit tough. If they hadn't sliced it as thin as they did
column13: it probably would not have been edible.\n\nNot sure I would order from here again. I think the next time we have a Thai food craving
column14: I might just drive somewhere else for a pick-up instead."

author: J. Martin Wills
text: "You could not and can not
column5: find a better Thai Kitchen around NJ-or-NYC.\nThis fine establishment
column6:
serving food like a TEN STAR RESTAURANT.
Very kind and inviting owner from Thailand who makes every genuine dish with brilliance that's absolutely memorable and satiating.

Chicken Satay
column7: chicken chili-basil.\n...although the Chicken Pad Thai is equally unforgettable
column8: and couples with spring roll.\n\nLocal LEO's often kindly-lenient/considerate with unobtrusive motorcycle parking on sidewalk
column9: allowing good visibility from BIG windows.  Street parking a truck can be a challenge
column11: it's worth the effort of walking several blocks
column12: to reach this corner.\n\nFOOD here's like eating from a TEN STAR RESTAURANT."

author: Kristina Bodnya
text: 'This is not the 1st time I’m putting “no onion please” in my online order and getting this much onion. Moreover
column5: there’s no other vegetables in my rice except for a tiny piece of tomato. The rice itself is extremely dry as if it was cooked a week ago. I don’t think I’m gonna order from them again.'

author: Marthaa Almond
text: 'We enjoy to go out. Last night we arrived in this superb place which friends recommended to us. We had a beautiful time there with great meal and a professional crew and  a professional  chef. We  added this fine restaurant in our list  and we will no doubt go again soon. We warmly recommend.'

author: Nicole Herr
text: 'Best pad thai in town'

author: Lyndsey R
text: 'Ordered delivery and it never showed
column5: and no answer when trying to call'

author: Clay Parks
text: 'The customer service is constantly swift
column5: awesome vibes
column6: helpful staff members. Will eat here again when I arrive in town.'

author: N Phalen
text: 'Authentic and delicious. Friendly service.'

author: Bob Treue
text: "Sri Thai is Hoboken's hidden gem. I love this place. Their best dish is Yum Ped (Crispy Duck salad)
column5: but we also had Koong Priew Wan (shrimp in  sweet & sour saurce with cucumber
column6: pineapples & tomato) & Koong Supparod (hot & spicy shrimp with pineapple
column7: cashew & chili sauce). You walk in and there are only a few seats
column8: but this place is always busy with take-out orders. My only caveat is that they are closed on Tuesdays. Eat here! It is worth the trip. Flavor explosion!"

author: Andrew Rosenkranz
text: 'Delivery from here always arrives late. The first time we ordered
column5: they were missing one of our dishes as well. I tried calling the restaurant to ask about the status of our late arriving order and it took 3 calls for someone to even answer the phone before they told me it would be arriving in 5-10 minutes. When it was finally delivered
column6: it was a full hour late'

author: Milly grace Dela cruz
text: 'Ambiance was simple but still pretty clean. I love how much light there is in the restaurant. As for the food
column5: not gonna lie I have been going to bangkok city for 7 years and this day
column6: I happened to only stop by sri thai because bangkok was closed.\n\nWe had chicken curry
column8: and shrimp pad thai. Portions are smaller than bangkok but the food did come out in a timely manner. Honestly? Nothing too special
column9: food was decent and satisfies the craving. I still prefer other thai restaurant but i also didnt leave feeling disappointed. :)'

author: Aziza Benatalah
text: 'Food was great
column5: the place is nice & cozy. But there was a delay in taking orders & serving. only one person taking phone orders
column6: online orders
column9: cashier & serving tables!!it is way too much for one person on a saturday night dinner restaurant.'

author: Brendan McDermott
text: 'So wonderful.  Great staff.  Amazing food.  Perfect.'

author: Mahmuda Haque
text: 'This place is very nicely decorated and has nice seating areas by the window (with like throw pillows and lights): very gram-worthy!! The food was good and there were a ton of options.'

author: Paige Pepitone
text: 'Decent thai food
column5: nothing particularly special
column6: service was fine!'

author: Lee Manor
text: "Ordered from here. pad Thai and shrimps were overcooked and pad see ew didn't have the smokey flavor it usually have"

author: Ry D’Lessio
text: "I've been to EVERY thai restaurant in Hoboken and Sri Thai WINS IT ALL! This is definitely my go-to spot when i'm in the mood for delicious thai food. As far as the interior goes
column5: it's a tiny restaurant (about 6-8  traditional square tables give or take). This will not accommodate bigger parties of more than 7-10 people per table. Unless you don't mind sitting separately. The servers are attentive and kind. Price points wise:\naffordable. Party of 4 with 3 appetizers (small serving)
column6: 3 soups
column7: and 4 main dishes includes white rice (from curry to noodles) came about less than $65 not including tax and tip. ** Kang Panang Curry is a MUST try! **\n\nLunch special from Mon-Fri is a steal! Less than $12
column8: which includes your choice of Salad OR Soup - NOT BOTH
column9: white rice and your main entree.\n\nside note: If you're a fan of EXTREME SPICY dishes
column10: this place isn't for you. You might need to request hot oil on the side to add in to your entree."

author: Cesar Duque
text: 'If you want REAL but not overpriced
column5: this is the place to go.'

author: Cynthia H.
text: 'I really enjoyed my visit here. Small and humble restaurant with the nicest staff! We had spring rolls and the chicken puff pastries for appetizers. Very light crust and great flavor. For entrees my BF had the red curry with beef and I had the yellow curry with squid. Both dishes spicy but tasty!  The Thai ice teas are sweet but had that authentic Thai tea flavor.\n\nIt was one of the staff’s birthday and the restaurant had a big feast for her- fish
column5: shrimp
column6: Thai noodles
column7: etc.  They sung her happy birthday with a fruit cake which they shared a slice with us! Very nice gesture and the cake was so good!\nI’ll be back whenever I’m in Hoboken!'

author: FATIMA ABDALAZIM
text: 'Amazing food good Thai tea'

author: Vickydute SR
text: 'Food was good 2 yrs back. I think the chef has changed'

author: Jordan Urbaczek
text: "Really enjoyed the food. It was delicious and the service was awesome. I shared the Chicken Pad Thai and Beef with garlic and white pepper. Great prices and atmosphere as well. However
column5: I prefer Bankok City Thai. It might be a few bucks pricier
column6: but it's the best in Hoboken."

author: Larry Thorner
text: "one of my wife's and my favorite places in Hoboken for Thai! She loves the Hoi Jor and we've never had a bad meal or experience"

author: Scott Walton
text: 'best thai in a 3 mile radias for sure'

author: Nishant Kumar
text: 'Excellent Panang Curry'

author: Johnny Chen
text: 'Got the Red Curry and it was so salty I couldn’t even finish it.  Flavors weren’t that great either.  T Thai a few blocks away is much better in flavor and quality.'

author: Bogdan Gologan
text: "It's good but nothing to write home about."

author: Katerina Karpova
text: 'Exceptional service with super yummy pad see ew!'

author: Nilesh Mehta
text: 'Love the pad thai. Lunch special is awesome deal too!!'

author: A Tulyani
text: 'Excellent food at a small family-owned spot'

author: Simon Burgess
text: "One of my fav Thai place in town!  Almost everything on the signature menu is good (haven't tried everything yet but so far so good)"

author: Mike P
text: 'was not a fan of the food
column5: but the inside is quite lovely and the service is friendly. a weird mix of classy wine toting adults and scrounging post-college young adults'

author: David Hsu
text: "Went for lunch on Veteran's Day. Was told no lunch specials since it was a holiday. Ordered from the full menu. I got stir fried glass noodles. Portion was small for standard menu item. It was just bleh. Nothing special at all. Will not be returning."

author: Freek Dirkx
text: 'Best Thai food in Hoboken'

author: Ashutosh Sharma
text: 'Borderline decent food.'

author: Harmit Singh
text: 'Review is based on an Indian vegetarian palate. The food was lacking flavor seasoning and overly used celery and cabbage. Overall a lack of fusion of flavor in both the veggie curry and noodle dish.'

author: Smooth Sensations
text: 'Service was super! Fast and wonderful I will definitely come back if ever in the area.'

author: Andrew G
text: "Friendly and efficient service doesn't make up for bland
column5: uninspired and sometimes straight-up bad Thai food. Sorry
column6: guys. The mango and sweet rice and the custard were nice

author: Albert Espiritu
text: 'The lunch menu is just the right portion and priced right.'

author: Steve Greifer
text: 'Fresh flavors
column5: every dish different
column6: great variety
column7: friendly service.  My favorite Thai in NJ for sure.'

author: Sharad Malhautra
text: 'TERRIBLE Thai Food !! Just got two curries ordered through Uber Eats. Never eaten such terrible Thai food in New Jersey! This would be the worst !'

author: James Shafer
text: 'Low-key
column5: affordable
column6: BYOB. My pork basil dish was very good.'

author: Sukanya Rangarajan
text: 'Corn fritters and  the green curry with rice are awesome ❤️❤️❤️'

author: Mahin Salimzade
text: 'So cute place
column5: food was very delicious that’s I forgot to make a photo
column6: ooops'

author: John Vidal
text: 'Really good thai food'

author: Sreevathsan Ravichandran
text: 'This is fried ice cream
column5: something unique that I tasted for first time
column6: It was awesome..'

author: Jason Oermann
text: 'Probably the best (though pricey given other options) Thai food in Hoboken.  Really enjoy their curry menu and coconut chicken soup.  Expect longer waits if you order delivery but it’s always worth the wait!'

author: Sneha Bhat
text: 'Food was okay. No lunch specials on weekends :('

author: Rockdaddyme meggie
text: 'The best Thai food ever - we came all the way from England'

author: Sunil Jain
text: 'Nice Thai'

author: Youlan Yu
text: 'The service and the setting were not bad
column5: yet the green curry was a bit far from authentic.'

author: Pearl Stars
text: "It is okay. The papaya salad was not authentic and same goes for other dishes. The food is customised to the public in Hoboken and therefore has lost the actual authentic taste. Thai ice tea and mango sticky rice were good. I'm going again to ask the chef to make it Thai spicy and see if that changes my review."

author: Grace McKay
text: 'Food is good
column5: a little difficult service-wise.  Little hole in the wall place'

author: Mike Reid
text: 'Pad Thai and see ew'

author: Amrita Patnaik
text: "I've been coming here/ordering take out consistently for over 5 years now
column5: and I love Sri Thai after all this time. The food is always amazing and the waitress we always get is so friendly and nice."

author: C M
text: 'Good pad thai'

author: Priscila Avila
text: 'It provides a serene setting to have dinner at. I enjoyed it.'

author: Parth Patel
text: 'Good food and great prices. Service was quick. Nice little restaurant. The food was delicious but I have had better Thai food elsewhere. Overall a great place though with yummy food. Lots of vegetarian options.'

author: Erdem
text: 'Good prices'

author: James Lee
text: 'our favorite Thai in the area... great food!'

author: Upneet Bindra
text: 'Pretty good standard Thai food
column5: good service
column6: BYOB
column7:
reasonable prices. Nothing to complain.

We ordered the basics- had basil fried rice with chicken and basil chicken with chilly. The portion was generous and the dishes were authentic and were absolutely delicious.

This is probably one of the better thai places in the area!

Will visit again!'

author: HJB Productions
text: "I was here to shoot food photography for UberEat and had the opportunity to try out the food. The food is super delicious and I will highly recommend this place. It's on a busy street but once you are in the restaurant it feels very homely with great ambient."

author: Bhadesh Basdeo
text: 'Food is great. Price is even better. Small and very cozy.'

author: sonu patel
text: "I went to this place with my friends. We are pure vegetarian and we usually don't get many options
column5: but this place had enough options. They also customised the dishes for us. We ordered few dishes and they were all delicious. Good service as well! :)"

author: Aaron Rosa
text: "My boyfriend and like to get take out here. It's always a great option when we get bored of all of the other options for a quick dinner in Hoboken. Their foods consistently tasty at a great price."

author: Bobby Axelrod
text: 'Love ❤ this little gem
column5: I eat here at least once a week.'

author: Vishal
text: 'Once you walk in you get hungry instantly. Here the Thai food is definitely different and service is fast.'

author: Michael Cappelleri
text: 'Authentic Thai food
column5: can be difficult to find in this area. Servers are fantastic
column6: food is great. Must try the Thai iced tea!'

author: Kendall Speten-Hansen
text: "This is a really great place for Thai food in Hoboken. I have eaten here many times and haven't been disappointed. The curries are not too oily and have plenty of veggies
column5: meat
column6: tofu (depending on what you order).\n\nThe staff is wonderful. On one recent visit
column7: I wanted one of the bench seats by the window and the staff was perfectly friendly about letting our party wait until the table was clear.\n\nLike many places in Hoboken
column8: Sri Thai is BYOB and the staff is very helpful pouring glasses or even brining out a chilling bucket to keep white wine cool while you eat.\n\nI have stopped by for take-out many times and it is always prepared quickly."

author: Randolph Hoppe
text: 'So good!'

author: Greg Harrison
text: 'Worse Thai in Hoboken.  Have given it a few tries but consistently bad.'

author: Purvin Patel
text: 'Very tasty. Finally another good option for Thai food in Hoboken'

author: Keith Jackson
text: 'BYOB. simple yet classic Thai.  Best in the area. Love the chicken and basil. Good appetizers and most of the food is tasty.'

author: Andrew Stranovsky
text: 'Still my favorite Thai food place in Hoboken.  Service is quick and food is great'

author: Avinash Salgam (Avi)
text: 'Kind staff
column5: quiet restaurant. The thai food is delicious but the beef could be juicier.'

author: Avinash Tallam
text: 'Good food. Good ambience but ordering is difficult!'

author: Dima
text: 'Very cozy'

author: Boris Yakubchik
text: 'Ordered 4 dishes for takeout and they were all great.'

author: Josh Ellison
text: "Waiting for food to arrive. Girl had to call back three times because first time she realized they didn't have anymore of a desert I ordered.  Then she said for an extra dollar I can choose different desert
column5: even though they are all same prices
column6: them called back twice because she couldn't understand my credit card number. Ordered at 9:20pm. Probably going to be waiting until 10:30 for two dishes.\n\nNeed someone else on the phones. Hopefully the food is good. .."

author: Omkar Sankaran
text: "It's a small place with about 10 tables but the food was good. It was not crowded when we went for a late lunch over a weekend; We told the waiter that we were vegetarians
column5: she pointed out a few dishes that did not have meat or poultry and also identified the ones that had fish sauce. They were also able to customize dishes to suit our palette."

author: mazzsterable
text: 'Great thai.  Food is fresh and delicious.  Favs include panang curry
column5: papaya salad
column6: Larb kai (wo the crunchy rice on top)
column7: and anything with chili basil sauce.'

author: Zenn Tomokane
text: 'Hidden behind the congestion of Washington street this spot serves you well. The service is friendly and polite they make you feel welcome to come back again. The food is authentic Thai: you can peek behind the cashier to see their Thai chefs fire up the orders. Crab fried rice. Green curry. Pad Thai.'

author: Ofer Bezalel
text: 'Still after 10 years I find myself ordering from them time and again...\n\nIts far from perfect
column5: but by far the best Thai in Hoboken and the area.\n\nSome of my favorites include
column6: Sri Thai Triple Delight
column8: Green Curry with Eggplants & Beef Basil (though careful
column9: its usually HOT).\n\nOn the down side
column10: they are very stingy on the rice

author: Ashish Raj
text: 'Sat here for 15-20 min and nobody acknowledges our presence.. Called the waitress to give order and she seemed in a hurry to run off n infact she did with our menu!! She never asked for any beverage and neither offered even water. I WORST SERVICE TILL NOW. Food is just alright.. Appetizers was good but not the main course..'

author: Alex Schkrutz
text: 'Great vegetable spring rolls (paw pia)'
